revised_title: Victorian Scientists and Speed Regulation: A Study of Interpersonal Relationships and the Evolution of Science and Technology
tldr: This article explores the involvement of six Victorian scientists, including G.B. Airy, C.W. Siemens, L. Foucault, J.C. Maxwell, Lord Kelvin, and J.W. Gibbs, in the development of speed regulation technology. It examines their roles in the history of automatic control, interpersonal relationships, and the evolving relationship between science and technology during the 19th century.
scientific_discipline: Social Sciences, Art, and Humanities > History of Science
